content.description: Start at the bottom of the of the left facing arch… or wherever you want really. Follow the arch and top out at the top left corner… or wherever you want, really.
content.protection: A pad if you need it
content.location: On the side of the boulder facing the road

content.description: Sit start with a small, sharp gaston for the left hand and a lower but better crimp for the right. With a high right foot next to your right hand, pull up hard and go for the slopey shelf with your right hand. Move up the face from here to the juggy lip, and top out using the tree for extra style points.
content.location: Middle and likely only climb on the Hidden Quartz Boulder. Top is very mossy and could use a good cleaning

content.description: Start in the dirty, juggy crack as far right as possible. Work left, using a good wedged block hold to move past the tree. Continue traversing the lip and mantel the arete as for snakes.
content.location: Far side of the face, lookers right of the other two problems.

content.description: Start left hand loaf jug on arete and right hand quartz crimp with a sneaky thumb catch. Heel hooks might help you, but you create you own destiny. Top out as for Serpent with a rock over.Felt harder than Serpent but might be height dependent
content.location: Back of boulder, left arete from Serpent.

content.description: Very secluded, small overhanging boulder up the hill from the Ship's Prow boulder. The boulder is a low ball, only reaching about 7-8 feet tall.
